entries.name: code
entries.desc: The HTTP result code string. For example, '302'.  You can also determine the response type by examining which response subclass the response object is an instance of.

entries.name: decode_content
entries.desc: Set to true automatically when the request did not contain an Accept-Encoding header from the user.

entries.name: http_version
entries.desc: The HTTP version supported by the server.

entries.name: message
entries.desc: The HTTP result message sent by the server. For example, 'Not Found'.

entries.name: msg
entries.desc: The HTTP result message sent by the server. For example, 'Not Found'.

entries.name: uri
entries.desc: The URI used to fetch this response.  The response URI is only available if a URI was used to create the request.

entries.name: body_permitted?()
entries.desc: true if the response has a body.

entries.name: body=(value)
entries.desc: Because it may be necessary to modify the body, Eg, decompression this method facilitates that.

entries.name: read_body(dest = nil, &block)
entries.desc: Gets the entity body returned by the remote HTTP server.

entries.name: value()
entries.desc: Raises an HTTP error if the response is not 2xx (success).
